column8: desc

column2: Klingon science through the lens of language
column8: We can explore Klingon science and technology (as seen on TV!) by looking at the language that describes it. We will use the vocabulary of John Ford's Klingonaase ("The Final Reflection") and Marc Okrand's tlhIngan Hol as a guide. We will compare and contrast it with other fictional Star Trek technologies, and with present-day reality.

column2: Plus Size Cosplay - No Limits, No Restrictions
column8: I'll be going over some of the common misconceptions about "appropriate" body types to cosplay. I'll be touching on the intersectionality of the body positive movement and cosplay. I'll also be highlighting some of the major plus size cosplayers out there. There will be a brief Q&A at the end
Science videos for all ages!

column2: The KAG Podcast: What the baQa' are we trying to do?
column8: General discussion of the KAG podcast. What we have done, what we plan to do and what do you want us to talk about?
Want to jump in to the world of cosplay? Learn from a professional how to get started!
Klingon fans breakdown their favorite Klingon episodes, Klingon characters, and Klingon show moments!

It's a very merry unbirthday for all of Starbase Indy! Give yourself some good advice and join Kassa for a bit of tea, cocoa, or coffee and a snack. Meet a new friend. Reconnect with old acquaintances. Immerse yourself in nonsense. Score an unbirthday present by answering science and science-fiction based trivia, or just hang out with a group of eclectic folks just like you (or totally different from you.) Can't make it for the full event but want to nosh a tiny bit? That's fine. Come when you can and as you are. Everyone is welcome!

Scythe is a board game set in an alternate-history 1920s period. It is a time of farming and war, broken hearts and rusted gears, innovation and valor. In Scythe, each player represents a fallen leader attempting to restore their honor and lead their faction to power in Eastern Europa. Players conquer territory, enlist new recruits, reap resources, gain villagers, build structures, and activate monstrous mechs. We're looking for 3-5 players to join us in a game of Scythe (https://stonemaiergames.com/games/scythe/). We can teach you to play it, but if you're already familiar, all the better! We will be using the "Invaders From Afar" expansion.

column2: Kate's Take Live Podcast of Star Trek 3: The Search for Spock
column8: Kate's Take will once again record live their journey into Star Trek movies with The Search for Spock. Your host Kate Chaplin is joined by her Trekkie husband, Josh as they find the universal messages and lessons in the Star Trek movies. The show will be recorded live (video & audio), have a Q&A and be on iTunes, You Tube and most streaming services. Kate's Take is a 5-time award-winning podcast presented by Gal's Guide to the Galaxy.

column2: Evolution in Star Trek: Why are There so Many Humanoid Species?
column8: Most aliens we see in Trek are not only carbon- and water-based, but they are humanoid, and many can even breed with humans. This panel introduces real evolutionary concepts from Earth and applies them to testing 3 theories raised in various Trek episodes about why so many aliens may be humanoid.

Geared toward children, participants will explore the fascinating world of edible entomology, first learning about foods made of or with insects, then having the opportunity to taste several dishes contaning insects.

Cosplay culture has evolved with the times and diversity should be shown to reflect those changes. I will share my own experiences from my twenty-year history of costuming and cosplay in hopes of showing others tolerance, acceptance, and a way to embrace new experiences.

Star Trek: The Original Series was known for its exotic aliens. From the Orions to the Tholians, the Metrons to the Vians, tribbles and Trelane, and all the rest, Trek had some of the most unusual and visually stimulating aliens ever seen on television. Join us for a discussion of these aliens, how their appearance and actions affected the show, how they interrelated to humans, and how they had such a lasting influence on Trek and the fans.

column2: Scientific Counterarguments for Climate Change Skepticism
column8:
Increasingly America and other nations have become oblivious to the real effects of Climate Change on everyday life.  Some citizens argue that they are unaffected by our changing environment - so why should they care?

We’ll look at documented scientific trends in climate and weather that have affected everything from consumer prices to health care and infrastructure.  We will explore why it is important to translate climate change into cause and effect and how to effectively communicate the effects to create awareness and change at a local and national level.

Learn the basics of predicting, monitoring and recording the weather! We will build devices for you to take home to set up your very own Weather Center and you'll be able to predict the weather just like the pros!

column2: Klingon Courtship Ceremony: Prove your love for your significant other
column8: Klingon dating is a contact sport. Bring that person who is special to you and demonstrate your love for them by reciting epic poems of love. But be careful, they will be armed and dangerous. They will be given large furry objects to hurl your way. Be ready to duck.

Why do you like Star Trek? Is it the stories? The costumes? The engineering and science of space travel? Or maybe its the promise that in the 23rd and 24th centuries, mankind will have somehow found a way to rise above racism, misogyny, capitalism / poverty / hunger, and our bellicose nature? Join us for rousing discussion/celebration of cultural diversity in Star Trek, and its hope for the future.
Private mixer for United Federation of Science organizers
Ventriloquist Joseph Franklin brings a variety of characters to life in a show full of comedy, with a geeky twist!

What do you see other life forms looking like? What would they have that we don't? How do they survive on their planet? Create your vision of what you think other beings will look like when we make it to their planet in this craft workshop.

Join us as we extract the building blocks of life from a banana. Participants will have the opportunity to extract DNA from a banana, watch it form, and view it under a microscope. Space is extremely limited.

Every convention should have guidelines in place already to protect convention attendees from harrassment. This panel will help individuals that cosplay, as well as people that like to view and enjoy it, know how to make things easier and more enjoyable for everyone.

Moxie Anne Magnus breathes new life into the variety show the way Dr. Frankenstein breathed new life into that monster of his. Music, comedy, game show, and more! Come along for an hour of intergalactic awesomeness!

column2: Ain't No Party Like A Klingon Party!
column8: House parties, potlucks, room parties.... get tips, recipes, & ideas!
Kickoff your Starbase Indy experience with Opening Ceremonies hosted by Moxie Ann Magnus!

The engineering process is not just for the nitty-gritty details of hard SF-it's also a great way to develop a setting in a way that meshes with your plot. From requirements development to trade studies and conceptual design, the engineering process can be toned to just the right hardness for a space opera romp while lending texture to setting and plot.

Hosted by the fabulous Moxie Ann Magnus and judged by Aris of your local cosplay shop Incognito by Aris & Rome, this year’s cosplay event is sure to be extra spectacular. Come watch or participate in the costumed pageantry, win fabulous prizes and stay for dancing and karaoke directly following!

column2: Star Trek Attack Wing Tabletop Game
column8: Star Trek: Attack Wing is a tactical space combat miniatures game, featuring collectible pre-painted ships from the Star Trek Universe. Utilizing the FlightPath™ maneuver system, command your fleet in space combat & customize your ship with a captain, crew, weapons and tech upgrades. Choose fleets from the Dominion, Federation, Klingon and Romulan factions based on abilities, maneuvers, upgrades and more. Take command of your ship or fleet, defeat your opponent and save the universe...

If you are staying with us at the Wyndham, you are eligible to attend this special exclusive reception where you can nibble on hors d’oeuvres, meet other attendees, and rub elbows with our guest stars. There will be one hour of free drinks followed by an hour of cash bar.

(Note for non-Earth residents and time travelers: “Rub elbows” is a common figure of speech in the 21st century. Please do not actually attempt to rub the elbows of anyone else at this reception.)

Sexuality research is still in its infancy and is often contaminated by cultural beliefs about gender, stereotypical sex roles, and so on. This presentation will cover what we actually know to be true about sexual activities, arousal, and orientations, as well as how we know what we know. Be prepared to nerd out with lots of citations!

Join DJ Spinson Lot, the DJ who won't stop, as they entertain and delight you with karaoke, dance tunes, and general celebration. Take your cosplay for a spin on the dance floor, or just mingle with other attendeesOpen to all ages.

In a spirit of cooperation, the Federation and the Klingon Empire have come to an agreement to share resources along the Neutral Zone. One of these places is a small class M planet simply known as NZ0002. The planet is rich in dilithium ore. While excavating a rich vein, a Federation mining company found something buried in a rock face. This object of unknown origin was reported to Starfleet. The Federation has dispatched an Oberth Class Science Vessel, The USS Archimedes to investigate. Not to be outdone, the Klingon Empire has also sent out a "science" vessel the IKS Vulture, to make sure any information gleamed from this strange object is shared.
 
"Flies in Amber” is a Cthulhu Live! / Star Trek crossover LARP set in the 23rd century. This is the Original Series timeline. Players will take up the roles of Miners, Members of the crew of The Archimedes, and loyal servants of the Klingon Empire. There are several alien races to choose from and costumes are encouraged. Characters are pre-assigned but there may be some spaces left. See the Starbase Indy booth in the vendor room for more information.

When "Star Trek" first aired in 1966, it expanded the viewers' imaginations about what was possible in their lifetimes. Today, many of the space-age technologies displayed on the show, like space shuttles, cell phones, and desktop computers, have already gone from science fiction to science fact. Other innovations, like warp drive, teleportation, and medical tricorders are actively in development. Join us as we celebrate the 50th Anniversary of "Star Trek" - a show that continues to inform, enrich, and inspire.

column2: Are You A Werewolf and Other Games!
column8: Local gaming hotspot Game Paradise hosts four hours of social gaming. Come play "Secret Hitler," "Are You a Werewolf?" and many others. Don't know how to play? No problem! Game Paradise's volunteer is happy to teach you.

column2: From Aesop to Asimov: Sci-Fi as the Modern Fable
column8: For millennia, whether spinning them before the communal fire or beaming them directly into a VR headset, storytellers have used myth to enlighten, to encourage and to educate. Today, the minds behind science fiction have taken up the mantle of the myth makers, finding creativie and nuanced ways to tackle the questions of ethics, pushing the limits of imaginations to communicate ideas of immediate importance.

This panel will focus on the various philosophical themes that arise in various sci-fi media, including Star Trek, Star Wars, Battlestar Galactica, the films of Christopher Nolan, etc. The panelists have edited or contributed to several books exploring such themes and will facilitate an open-forum discussion with the audience on any topic in this area that may interest them, from artificial intelligence, to ethical dilemmas, to the very nature of reality. Come prepared with musings or questions you've been pondering about your favorite sci-fi films and TV shows!

column2: Star Trek Attack Wing Tabletop Demo
column8: Star Trek: Attack Wing is a tactical space combat miniatures game, featuring collectible pre-painted ships from the Star Trek Universe. Utilizing the FlightPath™ maneuver system, command your fleet in space combat & customize your ship with a captain, crew, weapons and tech upgrades. Choose fleets from the Dominion, Federation, Klingon and Romulan factions based on abilities, maneuvers, upgrades and more. Take command of your ship or fleet, defeat your opponent and save the universe...

Participate in one of the oldest Star Trek fan clubs in existence (formed in 1974) as they celebrate the past year's success in fandom. You can meet members of local ships and hear about their activites that include fundraisers, science and science fiction based outings, and charity events of all kinds. The annual meeting includes reports from all departments, presentation of awards for outstanding achievement, and usually, a drawing or two. If you wish, you can stick around after the meeting to chat with the Admiralty Board and other Starfleet Command members.
Personal genetic testing is more available than ever, thanks to companies like 23andMe. But what are the limits of what that testing can tell you? Find out!

The mining of our country’s natural resources is not just a simple matter of finding the desired ore and digging it up. Important economic and environmental considerations are involved in any mining venture. These include property costs, mining equipment costs, operational costs, and land reclamation costs. Fines for violations of environmental regulations may also be incurred. If a mining corporation is to make a profit, the value of the recovered ore must be greater than the sum of all of its mining costs plus any environmental fines. In this lab you will create a mining corporation and attempt to run a cookie mining operation that is both profitable and environmentally sound.

column2: The Moxie Magnus Choose Your Own Adventure RPG!
column8: You have been chosen for a quest! Strap yourself in folks as the room becomes a magical transport through time and space, taking us all on a quest to save the very existence of mankind! Moxie will guide you as you choose your path through dangers to gain amazing treasures! This is not your grandpappy’s dungeon crawl!

Join the inventor of the Klingon language and an actor who had to speak it on stage for a conversation about the language, how it came to be, and how it affected the actors who incorporated it into their work.

column2: The KAG Podcast: What the baQa' are we trying to do?
column8: General discussion of the KAG podcast. What we have done, what we plan to do and what do you want us to talk about?

column2: United Federation of Science Round Table
column8: MFS Indy will facilitate a private round table discussion amongst the Midwest MFS leadership teams in attendance. This roundtable will be designed to help strengthen the nascent Midwest MFS network and encourage collaboration between the cities.

Participate in this fun game for all ages of women of science history. Presented by Gal's Guide to the Galaxy, these time travelers of history will present 26 women from various sciences and see how many you knew and what new gals you might never have heard about in school.
The latest discoveries from NASA's Cassini mission to Saturn.

You are stranded on a remote planet and were only able to salvage what is in the Kit you have been given. Do you build a spaceship? Communications device? Signaling devices to find help? Or something to make life on your new home better?
It’s rocket science! But what type? Chemical rockets are standard, but there are other types of space propulsion, too: nuclear thermal, ion, solar sails, and more!

column2: John Billingsley and Bonita Friedericy Q&A

column8: Teddy Bear Tea is an opportunity for the young and the mature to show off their favorite Trek or other sci-fi themed 'stuffed' friends with others. Meet other collectors, glimpse other creations, make a new friend or two, play a game, maybe win a prize and just social. Admission is free to all con attendees and their 'stuffed' friends. Refreshments are provided, Hosts for 2017 include Starfleet Command members: Rose Ciccarone, and crew of USS Indianapolis NCC 1945-D.
Get your photo taken with John Billingsley and Bonita Friedericy. Additional fee required.

If you are interested in solar energy works, battery systems, and how many solar modules would take to run your home; come see Phil Teague, Co-Founder of Rectify Solar give a presentation on the ins and outs of solar energy!

The state of the art in virtual reality (VR) systems today is unique. We live in a time where VR systems and content have recently proven profitable as a consumer electronic device. Many of the "hard problems" have been solved and VR systems are on track to annually improve. In the past 30+ years of VR work, progress has been much slower. The holodeck from Star Trek represents the ultimate VR system. Users in the holodeck are are portrayed to experience seamless virtual environments where the simulation was "real." Currently available VR systems allow users to experience virtual environments with several limitations including the inability feel/touch, eat, or even smell items in the virtual world. Some recent work has been completed at Indiana University to provided VR system developers with a tool to help extend VR computers for electronic control of physical devices. This tool is named cy.PIPES. What this new innovation allows for is the easy construction of environmental feedback within a VR system. Developers need only to connect common house fans arranged around a VR space to simulate wind conditions. Similarly this could be done with heat lamps for heat feedback. Supporting olfactory (smell) feedback is also possible with common pieces and parts found at a hardware store. This presentation will explain how close we are to having a real working holodeck here in the year 2017. A cy.PIPES VR system will be setup for demonstration.

column2: Solution Squad: Putting the M in STEM
column8: STEM education is on the rise, and on the cutting edge of STEM comics comes Solution Squad, a team featuring math-themed superheroes. Now there's a full-size graphic novel with lessons and activities for grades 4-8! Join creator and Indiana middle school teacher Jim McClain as he shows you (with a free download code) how Solution Squad helps students better understand an abstract subject through comics! Solution Squad comics are available in print, in special landscape digital format perfect for classroom projection, and there's even a YouTube channel with Solution Squad character puppets!

Gene Roddenberry's Secular Humanism influenced his writing on Star Trek. Reba Wooden, Executive Director of Center For Inquiry Indiana, will talk about what Secular Humanism is. Center For Inquiry is a Secular Humanist organization that seeks to foster a secular society based on reason, science, freedom of inquiry, and humanist values. http://www.centerforinquiry.net/indy

Enjoy the musical stylings of the Klingon Pop Warrior. Ever wondered what if Britney Spears were a Klingon? This isn't exactly the same thing but it's as close as you're likely to get in this universe.

column2: Narrative and Storytelling in Science and Public Policy
column8: MFS Chicago will present a TED style talk on the effective use of narrative and story telling in science communication. The talk will be designed to fill a one-hour time slot, with a 30 to 45 minute talk followed by a 30 to 15 minute Q&A.
Get an autograph from John and Bonnie. Additional fee required
Brain-tapping symbionts and parasites aren’t new to science fiction, but combined with the evolving understanding of neurology, we can guess at some surprising results of this bio-hacking.
Participants will explore the fascinating world of edible entomology, first learning about foods made of or with insects, then having the opportunity to taste several dishes contaning insects.

An small history of costuming and modern cosplay followed by dress-up fun. Costumes, wigs, accessories will be provided. It will end with a short trek through the convention halls so everyone can see the costumes the kids have made for themselves.

column2: How Fan Clubs Can Enrich Your Life
column8: Finding your fellow fan. Fan Clubs are a way to connect and meet people who have similar enjoyments. The fan club also gives back by making your fandom more enriching. Come meet some of the various fan clubs (Starfleet, Klingons, Barfleet, Royal Manticore Navy) that are here at Starbase Indy as we share our experiences with you and listen to yours.

column2: What Do You Think of ST:Discovery?
column8: Matt Hoffman of the Indy Knights and Carl Doninger lead a discussion on CBS's new Star Trek series- "Star Trek:Discovery."
Robert O'Reilly answers your questions about his life, career and, of course, his time in the Star Trek universe.
March for Science Indianapolis will present a TED style talk on the intersection of science and society and the critical role that science literacy, via science communication, plays in our lives.
Get your picture taken with Robert O'Reilly. Additional fee required.

column2: Sherlock Holmes and the Beginning of Modern Forensic Science
column8: Arthur Conan Doyle's character, Sherlock Holmes, was the first fictional detective to explicitly base his solutions of cases on observation, science, and deductive reasoning. Many of the stories include accounts of Holmes' detailed examinations of crime scenes and pieces of evidence. David Zauner, a member of the Indianapolis Sherlock Holmes society, The Illustrious Clients, and a retired forensic scientist, will explore how the Holmes stories reflect applications of scientific principles to criminal investigations in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries and how forensic science has developed since that time to its present state.

Several recent space movies are great examples of how mathematics and physics are integral to space travel. We'll look at short clips from movies like Interstellar, The Martian, and Hidden Figures, and talk informally about some of the math behind the scenes. If math normally isn't your cup of Tea, Earl Grey, Hot...don't worry! This won't be a boring math lecture!
Are you a Super Hero? Villain? In this no-sew craft project you can make a cape that shows the world what your super powers are!

column2: What Do You Think of The Orville?
column8: "Geeking in Indiana" host Tony Troxell and Carl Doninger lead a discussion on Seth MacFarlane's new series, "The Orville."

column2: Five Year Mission: Year Four Storytellers Unplugged
column8: Preeminent Star Trek band Five Year Mission takes you behind the scenes to discuss the making of their upcoming new album, Year Four. Conducted in a story teller’s format, the band’s songwriters will discuss the process of creating songs based on episodes of The Original Series, beginning with what inspired them about the episode in question, the creative process, and finally an acoustic performance of the completed song. Sometimes the journey is even more fascinating than the destination!
The Klingon Pop Warrior leads a discussion with translators on her project on the translation process - performing some songs & diving into translation techniques.

March for Science Indianapolis will present a TED style talk on the cutting edge of science and technology and their impact on society. The talk will be built around the quote “the future is already here it is just not evenly distributed” by William Gibson.
Get Robert O'Reilly's autograph. Additional fee required.

column2: Technobabble vs Hocus Pocus: Reassessing the Value of the Mohs Scale of Science Fiction Hardness
column8:
The last few decades have seen a fundamental increase in the value of scientific accuracy in the science fiction genre. To this end, the “Mohs Scale of Science Fiction Hardness" has been established, scoring a given work of sci-fi on a scale of one to ten. For example, George Lucas' Star Wars falls in the lower in the spectrum, while Duncan Jones' Moon enjoys a far higher score.
 
Questions: Has this push been necessary? Has it improved or damaged the genre as a whole? Is the assessed Mohs value of a given work even correct?
Science fiction tropes often prioritize fiction over science. We’ll discuss these and how a little more science can spice things up.
The linguist who created the Star Trek languages talks about his field of study beyond the world of Star Trek.
Learn about some of the easier to spot constellations as viewed from Earth and the legends that were inspired by them... And then, create your very own constellation and legend.

column2: Genetics in Star Trek: Inheritance, Mutations, and Genetic Engineering
column8: The Star Trek series spanned 5 decades in which scientists made major advances in our understanding of genetics. We'll look at genetics in Star Trek and real life and talk about how some recent advances may make some depictions in the series more realistic than seemed possible at the time.

You've heard the words of Kahless, you've spoken the words; now come and share with us how those words have affected your daily life. How do you incorporate Kahless' teachings into your everyday activities.
March for Science Indianapolis will present a TED style talk on current technologies that were science fiction when Star Trek TOS and even TNG were created.

The Trials of Terra Nova is a LARP (Live Action Role Playing) system offering a broad and engaging character creation and development system. And take place expansive and detailed fantasy world. Come and learn more about us, meet the Game Masters and players, peruse the props we use, and learn how much fun LARPing can be. After the presentation and question & answer session, please stay for interactive, hands-on demonstration where you can pick up a sword and shield and learn how we fight.
Join Thomas from local Broken Beaker Distillery, as they explain the science of distilling, & their journey into creating one of the first commercial distilleries in Indiana.

Dr. David Wolf has been to space four times, logging 168 days, 12 hours, 56 minutes and 4 seconds in space. He’s been on seven space walks totaling 41 hours and 17 minutes. Listen to him talk about his experiences.
Come and ask the Klingon Pop Warrior questions! Learn about why she's singing these songs in Klingon, the recording process, the Kickstarter process and more!

column2: Brew Your Own Beer with Science!
column8: It's not all starships and laser surgery, science is also responsible for all that foamy goodness! Join Skip as he discusses yeast, fermintation and how to harness the raw power of science at home!

Dinner with the Stars is a fan favorite event. Attendees
who participate get to enjoy a meal with our media
guests and performers. Special performances round
out the evening, creating memories our attendees talk
about for years.
Additional fee required.

These workshops will be run by city leaders with expertise in a given area, in order to share knowledge and best practices across the network. The workshops will be one-hour apiece and designed to have attendees leave with an actionable skill/plan for implementation.

A hilarious one-hour presentation of mostly-true stories from the life of the Very Vocal Viking. While one can never be sure exactly what he will say, likely topics typically include the parenting of precocious and sarcastic children, yummy food, unashamed geekiness, the care and feeding of giant fireballs, and making friends with guys with face tattoos.

We are going to bring you a blast from the past 90 mins of Saturday morning goodness but all IN Space We will be covering shows such as Star Trek The Animated Series. Star Wars Droids Space Ace and one show that we plan on destroying in riftrax from Gilligan's Planet
This will be a hands-on workshop where students and kids-at-heart can work in teams to design, build, and program a LEGO robot. No previous experience with programming or robotics is necessary!
March for Science Indy will provide about half a dozen science / engineering / math subject matter experts interested in answering your questions.

column2: Five Year Mission: Spock & Roll Concert
column8: The members Five Year Mission are endeavoring to write an original song for every episode of Star Trek: The Original Series, and the upcoming release of their new album, Year Four, will bring them closer than ever before to completion of the project. In this concert experience, the band will perform live renditions of songs from the album - some for the first time - as well as many longtime fan favorites from their catalogue. You won’t want to miss this singular event: To do so would be highly illogical!

Participants must be 21 or older as some of the parties will involve alcohol and will check IDs at the door.
Wind down in this low-key room with a variety of activities including coloring, cuddling and conversation. Come early for special, regimental hospitality provided by the Royal Manticoran Navy.

column2: Virtual Reality: Try out the IU VR Rig
column8: Actually get a chance to come out and try the IU Advanced Visualization Lab's cy.PIPES VR system and get a glimpse into what the holodeck would be like. No ordinary VR rig, this system simulates the environmental surroundings of the participant, creating a more sensory experience.

column8: Local gaming hotspot Game Paradise hosts four hours of social gaming. Come play "Secret Hitler," "Are You a Werewolf?" and many others. Don't know how to play? No problem! Game Paradise's volunteer is happy to teach you.

Capricon 38: Expanding Universes - Exploring the infinite loop from the written word to the moving picture to the game board and screen ideas take many forms and often inspire and borrow from one another. Come hear more about Capricon 38: Expanding Universes.

column2: John Billingsley and Bonita Friedericy Q&A
Klingons to Starfleet: What's In A Uniform?
column8: Klingon (and Trek) costuming can seem daunting to a beginner but not everyone can afford to buy a fancy uniform. Come get tips, tricks, & ideas on creating a uniform - from screen accurate to inspired by!

column2: Star Trek: The Future of Medicine
column8: What does Star Trek have to say about the future of medicine? Will we suffer from Darnay's disease or "xenopolycythemia?" What impact has Star Trek had on the way we practice medicine today? What does Star Trek say about
Make your very own Tribble to take home at the Science Carnival!

column2: Student Sunday: Robot Freeze Tag! The Federation vs. Klingon Empire
column8: Federation vs. Klingons in a game of team freeze tag with VEX-IQ Robots. while battling to the death learn about Robotics in the elementary schools. For children of all ages. Learn how we are preparing the next generation of Noonien Soongs, and have some fun in the process.
Hands-on workshop where kids and kids-at-heart can work in teams to design, build, and program a LEGO robot. No previous experience with programming or robotics is necessary!
Learn about energy by playing with toys.

We will be learning about Siege weapons of the past.
Namely catapults. And together we'll make our own!
Kids will use models to figure out what type of blood is safe to give different blood types.
You won't believe your eyes! Make your own and learn about the science behind optical illusions.

What makes a dog look like a dog? What makes a human look like a human? What makes a Klingon look like a Klingon? Deoxyribonucleic acid, DNA, the stuff in every cell of your body that contains all of the genes that make you unique. We all know it’s vitally important in medicine, in crime scene investigation, in growing food, and other extremely important parts of our lives. But, have you ever seen DNA first-hand? Stop by and we will show you how to extract DNA that you can see and touch using common household items.

On Sunday, all day, MFS Indy will facilitate FIRST robotics teams to demo their robots. We will be holding a “high score” day long competition where people attempt a timed scoring challenge and their score is posted on a leaderboard. The winner will win a prize at the end of the day!

Robert O'Reilly answers your questions about his life, career and, of course, his time in the Star Trek universe.

Indiana Light Saber Academy trains padewans young and old(er) to harness the power of the force and defeat their enemies.  Padded sabers and equipment will be provided. We welcome people to bring their own sabers though we will provide for those who do not own one. Watching requires an SBI membership; to compete requires a $5 dollar entry fee for insurance on the sabers.

Imagine going to work where other people go for vacation… Imagine watching the result of your collaborative work on display for the whole world…Imagine what a two week orientation at NASA would be like. Imagine no longer, I’ll tell you.

column2: Star Wars Biology vs. Star Trek Biology
column8: Does the biology in Star Wars make more sense than Star Trek? Two scientists argue for the superiority of the biological Sciences in their chosen fandom.

column2: Getting a Head in the Klingon Empire
column8: Qob! will demonstrate prosthetic makeup application, tricks and techniques. Also repair on in field modifications
Get John and Bonnie's signature. Additional fee required.
Get your Robert O'Reilly's autograph. Additional fee required.

This presentation is a companion to "Sherlock Holmes and the Beginning of Modern Forensic Science". David Zauner will talk about the current capabilities of forensic science, some of the challenges forensic scientists are facing, and how new technology and methods have the potential to make major changes in crime scene investigation and laboratory examination.
Kyle Hill, live on stage, sharing some of his Because Science! Magic.

Dressing up as one of the most powerful and feared species in the galaxy doesn't need to be intimidating. Learn about easy sewing projects and tips, modifying existing pieces to look Klingon, and putting together a Klingon look using human clothing pieces.

column2: March for Science Education Grant Award
column8: The March for Science Indianapolis organization will announce the winners of their STEM grants. These grants are being awarded to high school and middle school teachers who submit engaging and cost-effedctive STEM curriculum that can be shared openly between teachers via our grant program.
Get your picture taken with Kyle Hill. Additional fee required.

Let’s close SBI’s first Student Sunday science carnival with a joyful costume parade and photo op! Gather up your geeklings and meet at Guinan’s Place. Dress as your favorite scientist or science fiction character and you will have the opportunity to show off your fancy duds as we parade with music and merriment around the con and up onto the main stage/bridge set for a group picture to commemorate the day’s fun! Prizes for the younglings who participate provided by your friendly Indianapolis cosplay store Incognito by Aris & Rome.

Attendees will actively participate in the planning stages of homesteading a newly discovered planet that is able to sustain the flora and fauna of life as we know it. Space and weight are limited for our planetary pioneers, and every candidate and pound of cargo must be taken into consideration as the flagship homesteaders prepare for their journey. Participants will each have the opportunity to decide who and what to take, and will then find out if their team was able to successfully homestead our new planet.

Love Tribbles? Have a cat or dog? Why not share your love of tribbles with your pet by creating a tribble with catnip inside or a squeaky tribble for your dog? Panel would supply materials for guests to create either a catnip filled tribble for a cat or a squeaky toy filled tribble for a dog.

column2: Complete your Klingon With Props & Accessories
column8: Do you want your costume to stand out from the rest? There is honor in Accessorizing! come join us for a run down on prop and accessory making, how to decide what to add and what to avoid. Learn from our mistakes and our successes.
The culimnation of Sunday's Light Saber Training, come watch the finalists battle each other for the glory of the Force.
Come share your thoughts about the convention and find out how you can be more involved next year.
